transcript:
drawing room and were obviously trying to restrain within the bounds of de- corum the excitement and mirth that shone in all their faces. Evidently in the back rooms, from which they had dashed out so impetu- ously, the conversation had been more amus- ing than the drawing-room talk of society scan- dals, the weather, and Countess Apraksina. Now and then they glanced at one another, hardly able to suppress their laughter. 
The two young men, the student and the officer, friends from childhood
